meanings.definition: In a kind or gentle manner.
meanings.sent1: She smiled benignly at the children playing in the park.
meanings.sent2: He spoke benignly to his elderly neighbor, offering to help with groceries.
meanings.sent3: The cat benignly watched the birds outside, dreaming of catching one.
meanings.sent4: The sun shone benignly on the peaceful meadow, warming the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The old man benignly patted the dog's head, showing his affection.

meanings.sent1: The nurse's benignly smile reassured the worried patient.

meanings.sent4: The puppy's eyes had a benignly look, melting everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent5: The park had a benignly atmosphere, inviting people to relax and enjoy nature.

meanings.sent1: The spider in the corner was benignly, just minding its own business.
meanings.sent2: The plant in the garden was benignly, adding beauty without any danger.
meanings.sent3: The rumor turned out to be benignly, causing no real trouble.

meanings.sent5: The medicine worked benignly, curing the illness without side effects.
